page.title: 11TRANSPORT IN PETROCKSTOWE
page.content: Most people in{Petrockstowe}can drive: they learn young, first on a tractor, and graduate up via motorbike to car. 89% of households own at least 1 car or van, 31% own 2. Nearly half also own a motorbike and/or bicycle. It is virtually essential to own a vehicle, as there is{little public transport: the railway line to Petrockstowe closed 1982 and bus services are very limited, suitable for shopping in Bideford or Barnstaple, but inadequate for getting to and from work. Mothers drive their children to Playgroup, or School at Merton. Men drive to work, on a nearby farm,the clayworks, or office in local towns. There are only 4 retail premises: one is a 2-pump petrol station. To visit London you can travel by train or coach from Exeter, but you have to drive 40 miles to Exeter to start !
